tests.title: ("proof.id") An optional identifier for the proof, which MUST be a URL.

cell.rowId: If the proof type is DataIntegrityProof, cryptosuite MUST be specified; otherwise, cryptosuite MAY be specified. If specified, its value MUST be a string.

tests.title: The date and time the proof was created is OPTIONAL and, if included, MUST be specified as an [XMLSCHEMA11-2] dateTimeStamp string, either in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC), denoted by a Z at the end of the value, or with a time zone offset relative to UTC.

cell.rowId: The date and time the proof was created is OPTIONAL and, if included, MUST be specified as an [XMLSCHEMA11-2] dateTimeStamp string, either in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC), denoted by a Z at the end of the value, or with a time zone offset relative to UTC.

tests.title: The expires property is OPTIONAL and, if present, specifies when the proof expires. If present, it MUST be an [XMLSCHEMA11-2] dateTimeStamp string, either in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC), denoted by a Z at the end of the value, or with a time zone offset relative to UTC.

cell.rowId: The expires property is OPTIONAL and, if present, specifies when the proof expires. If present, it MUST be an [XMLSCHEMA11-2] dateTimeStamp string, either in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC), denoted by a Z at the end of the value, or with a time zone offset relative to UTC.

cell.rowId: A verification method is the means and information needed to verify the proof. If included, the value MUST be a string that maps to a [URL]

tests.title: The reason the proof was created ("proof.proofPurpose") MUST be specified as a string that maps to a URL

cell.rowId: The reason the proof was created ("proof.proofPurpose") MUST be specified as a string that maps to a URL

tests.title: ("proof.proofValue") A string value that contains the base-encoded binary data necessary to verify the digital proof using the verificationMethod specified. The contents of the value MUST be expressed with a header and encoding as described in Section 2.4 Multibase of the Controller Documents 1.0 specification.

cell.rowId: ("proof.proofValue") A string value that contains the base-encoded binary data necessary to verify the digital proof using the verificationMethod specified. The contents of the value MUST be expressed with a header and encoding as described in Section 2.4 Multibase of the Controller Documents 1.0 specification.

tests.title: The domain property is OPTIONAL. It conveys one or more security domains in which the proof is meant to be used. If specified, the associated value MUST be either a string, or an unordered set of strings. A verifier SHOULD use the value to ensure that the proof was intended to be used in the security domain in which the verifier is operating.

cell.rowId: The domain property is OPTIONAL. It conveys one or more security domains in which the proof is meant to be used. If specified, the associated value MUST be either a string, or an unordered set of strings. A verifier SHOULD use the value to ensure that the proof was intended to be used in the security domain in which the verifier is operating.

tests.title: (challenge) A string value that SHOULD be included in a proof if a domain is specified.

cell.rowId: (challenge) A string value that SHOULD be included in a proof if a domain is specified.

tests.title: if "proof.previousProof" field exists, it MUST be a string.

tests.title: if "proof.nonce" field exists, it MUST be a string.

cell.rowId: if "proof.nonce" field exists, it MUST be a string.

tests.title: Cryptographic suite designers MUST use mandatory proof value properties defined in Section 2.1 Proofs, and MAY define other properties specific to their cryptographic suite.

cell.rowId: Cryptographic suite designers MUST use mandatory proof value properties defined in Section 2.1 Proofs, and MAY define other properties specific to their cryptographic suite.

tests.title: Implementations that use JSON-LD processing, such as RDF Dataset Canonicalization [RDF-CANON], MUST throw an error, which SHOULD be DATA_LOSS_DETECTION_ERROR, when data is dropped by a JSON-LD processor, such as when an undefined term is detected in an input document.

cell.rowId: Implementations that use JSON-LD processing, such as RDF Dataset Canonicalization [RDF-CANON], MUST throw an error, which SHOULD be DATA_LOSS_DETECTION_ERROR, when data is dropped by a JSON-LD processor, such as when an undefined term is detected in an input document.

tests.title: The value of the cryptosuite property MUST be a string that identifies the cryptographic suite.

cell.rowId: The value of the cryptosuite property MUST be a string that identifies the cryptographic suite.

tests.title: The value of the cryptosuite property MUST be a string that identifies the cryptographic suite. If the processing environment supports subtypes of string, the type of the cryptosuite value MUST be the https://w3id.org/security#cryptosuiteString subtype of string.

cell.rowId: The value of the cryptosuite property MUST be a string that identifies the cryptographic suite. If the processing environment supports subtypes of string, the type of the cryptosuite value MUST be the https://w3id.org/security#cryptosuiteString subtype of string.

tests.title: If an @context property is not provided in a document that is being secured or verified, or the Data Integrity terms used in the document are not mapped by existing values in the @context property, implementations MUST inject or add an @context property with a value of https://w3id.org/security/data-integrity/v2.

cell.rowId: If an @context property is not provided in a document that is being secured or verified, or the Data Integrity terms used in the document are not mapped by existing values in the @context property, implementations MUST inject or add an @context property with a value of https://w3id.org/security/data-integrity/v2.

rows.id: The domain property is OPTIONAL. It conveys one or more security domains in which the proof is meant to be used. If specified, the associated value MUST be either a string, or an unordered set of strings. A verifier SHOULD use the value to ensure that the proof was intended to be used in the security domain in which the verifier is operating.

rows.id: The domain property is OPTIONAL. It conveys one or more security domains in which the proof is meant to be used. If specified, the associated value MUST be either a string, or an unordered set of strings. A verifier SHOULD use the value to ensure that the proof was intended to be used in the security domain in which the verifier is operating.
